00001 // ORUtilityProcessor.hh
00002 
00003 #ifndef _ORUtilityProcessor_hh_
00004 #define _ORUtilityProcessor_hh_
00005 
00006 #include "ORDataProcessor.hh"
00007 
00008 // This class is a base class for utility processors: processors that don't
00009 // actually handle data, and therefore do not need a dataid or a decoder.
00010 // Examples are the ORFileWriter and the ORCompoundProcessor.
00011 
00012 class ORUtilityProcessor : public ORDataProcessor 
00013 {
00014   public:
00015     ORUtilityProcessor() : ORDataProcessor(NULL) {}
00016     virtual ~ORUtilityProcessor() {}
00017 
00018     // overload the functions that set/use the unneccessary members of
00019     // ORDataProcessor
00020     virtual EReturnCode ProcessDataRecord(UInt_t*) { return kSuccess; }
00021     virtual void SetDataId() {}
00022     virtual void SetDecoderDictionary() {}
00023 
00024   private:
00025     // fDataDecoder is NULL by definition here and should not be accessed 
00026     // by deriving classes (to eliminate seg faults): make it private. If a
00027     // deriving class suddenly needs a decoder, it should make its own.
00028     ORDataProcessor::fDataDecoder; 
00029     // for that matter, make fDataId private too! It doesn't make any sense
00030     // in this context.
00031     ORDataProcessor::fDataId;
00032 };
00033 
00034 #endif
